abstract: Graham Bowley Inside Art column; excerpts from conversation with Edward Dolman, chairman and chief executive of Phillips auction house, about current economics of art world; Armory Show will emphasize quality over quantity with significantly fewer exhibitors than in previous years; Hauser & Wirth is constructing new space in Chelsea to replace its 18th Street gallery.
lead_paragraph: Auction houses are now operating in “a massive global business focused on contemporary art,” Edward Dolman says, influenced by international collectors from all parts of the world.

headline.main: Chairman of Phillips Sees Major Changes in Auctions
headline.print_headline: At Phillips, Talking Profits, Expansion and Outsiders

snippet: Auction houses are now operating in “a massive global business focused on contemporary art,” Edward Dolman says, influenced by international collectors from all parts of the world.

keywords.value: Armory Show, The International Fair of New Art (NYC)
keywords.name: subject
